c5f2b6b5-8bd3-4c71-8606-00e69866bf4d.description: Earners of the Wool appreciation course badge have a fundamental knowledge of the wool fibre, and the myriad of processes that make up the global wool supply chain.
c5f2b6b5-8bd3-4c71-8606-00e69866bf4d.name: Wool appreciation course

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Wool appreciation course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Define and describe the wool fibre, its source, properties and benefits to consumers across a range of end uses.
Outline the key quality specifications of the wool fibre that impact on end use.
Describe the key manufacturing processes for wool, from raw fibre through to worsted and woollen yarn.
Describe the key attributes and applications of yarn for knitwear and wovenwear.
Outline the key processes use knit, weave, dye and finish wool garments.
Explain the role of quality assurance testing and management in the global wool industry.
Explain the role of quality assurance testing and management in the global wool industry.

0e4bc732-8af1-4367-8107-67fbdb84ae19.description: Earners of the Knitwear design and make badge will have a foundational knowledge of wool knitwear design and manufacture.
0e4bc732-8af1-4367-8107-67fbdb84ae19.name: Knitwear design and make

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Knitwear design and make course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Explain the role and benefits of wool as a raw material for knitwear.
Outline, at a high level, the processes involved in producing wool yarn for knitwear.
Provide a high-level overview of the history of knitting and the evolution of knitting technologies.
Outline the evolution of knitwear design (including an exploration of the work of influential knitwear designers).
Appreciate the key elements of the design process.
Describe the main types of knitting machines currently used to manufacture knitted fabric and garments and their basic actions.
Explain the key knitted structures and techniques used to create knitwear.
Outline the key manufacturing routes for modern knitwear.
Outline the key elements involved in the ‘design and make processes’ for the key manufacturing routes.
Appreciate the classic body shapes and garment components that inform knitwear design alternatives.
Outline a range of common neck cuts and trims used to create knitted garments.
Describe a range of classic trims and pocket styles used to create knitted cardigans.
List a range of popular knitwear accessories and provide a brief overview of the production processes used to create them.

16024ea4-1018-4dc9-b653-ac7a149e442c.description: Earners of the Wool fibre science badge will have an understanding of the structure, physics and chemistry of the wool fibre.
16024ea4-1018-4dc9-b653-ac7a149e442c.name: Wool fibre science

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Wool fibre science course
Differentiate the properties of wool from other fibres.
Describe the structure of the wool fibre and the complex components that make up its structure.
Understand the physics of the fibre and the relationship between the physical properties and the fibre structure.
Understand the complex chemistry of the wool fibre and its impact on the behaviour of the fibre during processing and wear.
Describe the benefits of wool in terms of comfort, ease of wear, safety, appearance and versatility.

37c3486d-5f95-410c-a807-5e5b957b99e3.description: Earners of the Introduction to wool processing badge will have an understanding of the fibre’s journey, from farm to fashion.
37c3486d-5f95-410c-a807-5e5b957b99e3.name: Introduction to wool processing

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to wool processing course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Explain how wool is manufactured from a greasy raw fibre into worsted and woollen yarn.
Identify the different ways yarn can be woven or knitted and how this affects the end product.
Describe the processes used to dye and finish wool and the environmentally-responsible options associated with each process.
Explain the garment faults that can occur during processing and how to best prevent them.
Understand the importance of the quality assurance behind the Woolmark brand.
Identify different Merino wool innovations and how these can be used to enhance products made from wool.

cfe580cc-428b-4d3e-b68b-0ce8e0b787e5.description: Earners of the Sustainability and Wool badge have a foundational knowledge of the opportunities and solutions for creating products with a positive legacy. Designers and brands gain an understanding of how they can measure and manage the textile industry’s impact on people, planet and prosperity.
cfe580cc-428b-4d3e-b68b-0ce8e0b787e5.name: Sustainability and wool

badge_template_activities.title: To be awarded this level of industry recognition, learners must successfully complete the Woolmark Learning Centre’s Sustainability and Wool course, passing all knowledge checks associated with the badge standards outlined above.

Understand the concepts of sustainability and sustainable development and appreciate the impacts our activities are having on the planet, people and prosperity, from individuals to the global economy as a whole.

Outline the key global frameworks and systems that can support sustainable development and recognise how these frameworks can guide sustainable development, with a focus on the fashion and textiles industry.
Describe the various raw materials that form the building blocks of the fashion and textile industry and outline how they fit into the global textile supply chain.
Explain how traceability can be the first step for the textile industry to understand the industry’s impact on the three pillars of sustainability (planet, people and prosperity).
Discuss the concept of a circular economy in relation to the textile and fashion industry, and to wool in particular.
Describe a range of tools and programs that are available to help understand and manage potential risks and benefits of products and services from the textile and fashion industry.
Outline how wool can offer a sustainable solution for the textiles and fashion industry by investigating each stage of the wool lifecycle.

e4c76799-2aad-4998-a519-79fb32dd69be.description: Earners of the Raw Wool Scouring Badge have an advanced understanding of the process of wool scouring, aims and objectives, machinery used, issues affecting product quality and the impact of scouring quality on downstream processing.
e4c76799-2aad-4998-a519-79fb32dd69be.name: Raw wool scouring

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Raw Wool Scouring course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Provide a detailed and comprehensive overview of the wool scouring process.
Provide a comprehensive overview of the best-practice techniques relating to the wool scouring process that ensure maximum wool cleanliness and minimal entanglement.
Provide measures and techniques to resolve issues that might be encountered during the wool scouring process.

9ad6cae3-a5dc-464c-84db-c0cf0e9060f7.description: Earners of the Woven textile design and production badge will have a foundational knowledge of wool woven textile design and production.
9ad6cae3-a5dc-464c-84db-c0cf0e9060f7.name: Woven textile design and production

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Woven textile design and production course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Describe the raw materials used to produce contemporary woven textiles.
Explain, at a high level, the processes involved in producing wool yarn suitable for woven textiles.
Explain the benefits of wool as a raw material for weaving.
Provide a high-level overview of the history of weaving and weaving technologies.
Outline the basic principles of weaving and modern weaving technologies.
Appreciate the importance of fabric finishing to create high-quality woven cloth.
Describe a range of basic weaves and weave constructions.
Appreciate the impact of colour and weave combinations when designing woven textiles.
Identify a range of classic woven cloths and their origins.
Outline the key elements of woven textile design and production.

15075389-69cf-4423-8970-11489aa6a779.description: Earners of the Worsted and woollen spinning badge have an advanced understanding of production systems, the preparation of top for worsted spinning, worsted ring spinning, variations and alternatives for worsted ring spinning, preparation for woollen spinning, woollen spinning, post-spinning operations and quality assurance in worsted and woollen spinning operations.
15075389-69cf-4423-8970-11489aa6a779.name: Worsted and woollen spinning

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Worsted and woollen spinning course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Describe the operations required to prepare top for spinning.
Describe the aims of spinning and the operation of the ring spinning frame.
Outline alternative spinning technologies that can be used for worsted spinning of wool.
Describe the operation of a woollen card and the preparation of the slubbing for spinning.
Understand the key limitations and relevance of factors influencing the operation of the spinning machine.
Describe post-spinning operations.
Outline the role of and techniques in quality assurance programs for woollen and worsted spinning and post-spinning operations.

6fe5911b-7d14-4d21-9cda-c4a5d7f4b7d6.description: Earners of the Wool Introductory Course badge understand the role and purpose of the Woolmark Company and have a fundamental understanding of the origins, characteristics and benefits of wool as a superior natural fibre for a wide range of fashion and industrial applications and innovations.
6fe5911b-7d14-4d21-9cda-c4a5d7f4b7d6.name: Wool introductory course

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Wool Introductory Course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Explain the role and purpose of The Woolmark Company and Australian Wool Innovation in the global wool supply chain.
Describe the origins and key structural characteristics of the wool fibre.
Outline the unique consumer benefits of wool as a textile fibre.
Describe, at a high level, the woollen and worsted manufacturing routes.
Outline the meaning of the various symbols that dictate how wool is best cared for
Recognise the meaning of a range of Woolmark Licensing Logos
Explain why and how wool is used by designers across a wide range of fashion applications.
Describe a range of wool innovations that's stem from wool's inherent natural properties.

c594638a-ec78-4423-a476-0abf7b24ecae.description: Earners of the Worsted top-making badge have an advanced understanding of the worsted top-making process, its aims, the processes and equipment involved, and the factors affecting the final top characteristics and quality.
c594638a-ec78-4423-a476-0abf7b24ecae.name: Worsted top-making

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Worsted top-making course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Describe in detail the key fibre properties important in top-making.
Describe the role of the top-maker.
Describe the operations that make up early stage processing and top-making.
Outline, in general terms, the aims, processes and equipment used in each stage of top-making.
Outline the reasons for the processing conditions and sequence of operations used in top-making.
Describe the quality attributes of the output material (top) and the role of quality assurance in the top-making process.
Outline some of the chemical treatments conducted on top.

c18f0bcb-c23d-48c9-91b2-2b5a87bf5aed.description: Earners of the Dyeing of wool badge have an advanced understanding of wool dyeing, knowledge on how and when wool is dyed and information on how the fibre is prepared for dyeing and evaluated after dyeing.
c18f0bcb-c23d-48c9-91b2-2b5a87bf5aed.name: Dyeing of wool

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Dyeing of wool course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Describe how to dye wool and blends, the necessary preparation of the fibre and the machinery used.
Evaluate the appropriateness of specific dyeing operations.
Describe the side effects of dyeing and the associated environmental issues.

2fdcd557-6d74-4b29-b5f1-ea47c965d6c4.description: Earners of the Seamless knitting – Santoni technology badge have a foundational knowledge of seamless knitting technology and its diverse range of applications and benefits, with a focus on utilising wool and wool-blend yarns.
2fdcd557-6d74-4b29-b5f1-ea47c965d6c4.name: Seamless knitting – Santoni technology

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Seamless knitting – Santoni technology course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Describe a range of applications and design possibilities seamless knitting technology offers cutting-edge designers
Outline the key aspects of yarn selection designers need to consider when designing seamless garments.
List the characteristics of wool that make it a suitable yarn solution for seamless design innovations.
Explain, at a high level, how Santoni seamless machinery works and describe the main types of machinery for specific applications.

d80ff0a9-da74-4843-b054-4006552511cc.description: Earners of the Wool fabric finishing badge have an advanced understanding of the finishing processes applied to wool fabrics, the purpose and operations carried out under each procedure and the factors affecting the final quality of the finished product.
d80ff0a9-da74-4843-b054-4006552511cc.name: Wool fabric finishing

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Wool fabric finishing course on the Woolmark Learning Centre.
Evaluate finished wool fabrics produced within a weaving or knitting mill and assess whether the material meets the aims of the finishing operation.

bee3931e-aaa0-404c-a8f2-10f344c18139.description: The earner of this badge was a finalist in the Woolmark Performance Challenge. The Woolmark Performance Challenge is an annual product innovation competition open to tertiary students which presents an unrivalled opportunity for participants to apply the science and performance benefits of Australian Merino wool to innovative new product applications.
bee3931e-aaa0-404c-a8f2-10f344c18139.name: Finalist - Woolmark Performance Challenge

badge_template_activities.title: Must currently be enrolled in a tertiary institution. May be graduated by final judging phase
Submit a product proposal which applies the unique benefits of Australian Merino wool to innovative new product applications in the sports and performance market

4d3657d1-9c23-4183-82a6-8281c72f2ec4.description: The earner of this badge was a finalist of the International Woolmark Prize which celebrates outstanding fashion talents from across the globe. Selected from 300+ online applicants representing 50+ countries, this finalist is 1 of 10 designers selected to progress to the International Woolmark Prize final. The International Woolmark Prize is the world's most prestigious award and talent development program for rising fashion stars looking to shape a positive future for the industry.
4d3657d1-9c23-4183-82a6-8281c72f2ec4.name: Finalist - International Woolmark Prize

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate innovative use of fabrics and textiles and has been producing commercial products for a minimum of 2 years and a maximum of 8 years (at the time of submitting the application)
Demonstrate consistent experience in working with apparel supply chains and show yearly growth in sales
Develop an innovative Merino wool collection, which takes into consideration sustainability and supply chain transparency

bfe18b23-1f1a-4f07-8802-efef15f1f90b.description: Earners of the Wool Price Risk Management badge will have a foundational knowledge of risk, risk management strategies and hedging principles.
bfe18b23-1f1a-4f07-8802-efef15f1f90b.name: Wool price risk management

badge_template_activities.title: Identify examples of Australian agricultural innovation, both pre- and post-European settlement
Explain the importance of price risk management and understand the benefits of a well-functioning wool futures market
Outline the different types of risk associated with the wool pipeline
Describe the variety of risk management products and participants involved in the wool industry
Explain the concept of hedging principles relative to the wool industry
Describe how risk management strategies are developed and analysed to benefit the woolgrower.

c7117ac6-188b-4506-96bb-fdbcecc6c557.description: The earner of this badge is the winner of the International Woolmark Prize which celebrates outstanding fashion talents from across the globe. Selected from 300+ online applicants representing 50+ countries, this winner was selected from 10 finalists. The International Woolmark Prize is the world's most prestigious award and talent development program for rising fashion stars looking to shape a positive future for the industry.
c7117ac6-188b-4506-96bb-fdbcecc6c557.name: Winner - International Woolmark Prize

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate innovative use of fabrics and textiles and has been producing commercial products for a minimum of 2 years and a maximum of 8 years (at the time of submitting the application)
Demonstrate consistent experience in working with apparel supply chains and show yearly growth in sales
Develop an innovative Merino wool collection, which takes into consideration sustainability and supply chain transparency

01b6d58e-de92-4f8e-9789-076b77a0ece0.description: Earners of the Introduction to printing badge have a foundational knowledge of printing in the textile industry. They are familiar with a range of common commercial printing techniques and technologies used to create colour and interest in textiles and garments. Badge holders appreciate the key aspects to consider when selecting and using particular print technologies across a range of fabrics, including those created using wool and wool-blend yarns.
01b6d58e-de92-4f8e-9789-076b77a0ece0.name: Introduction to printing

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the Woolmark Learning Centre’s Introduction to printing course, passing all knowledge checks
Describe the most common printing methods and technologies used in the commercial textile printing industry.
Provide a high-level overview of the history of textile printing technologies.
Outline the key processes required to prepare textiles for various printing applications.
Outline, at a high level, the impact the physical and chemical attributes of various fibres and fabrics have when selecting suitable print methods and colourants.
Appreciate the key elements of the design and production process for a range of print technologies.
Differentiate between the different printing methods used for wool and other fibres and highlight the advantages and disadvantages of each method.
Outline the key impacts of textile printing on the environment and discuss how the textile industry is addressing some of these impacts.

40c59e09-5381-4b2f-b378-c4bdb94a2ab4.description: The earner of this badge is the winner of the Woolmark Performance Challenge. The Woolmark Performance Challenge is an annual product innovation competition open to tertiary students which presents an unrivalled opportunity for participants to apply the science and performance benefits of Australian Merino wool to innovative new product applications.
40c59e09-5381-4b2f-b378-c4bdb94a2ab4.name: Winner - Woolmark Performance Challenge

badge_template_activities.title: Must currently be enrolled in a tertiary institution. May be graduated by final judging phase
Submit a product proposal which applies the unique benefits of Australian Merino wool to innovative new product applications in the sports and performance market
Earn a paid internship with competition partner and opportunity to prototype winning product proposal

93b8d1e5-607f-480b-beb2-a727b1ed94e4.description: The winner of the Karl Lagerfeld prize is able to demonstrate a forward-thinking or sustainable approach to systems production, materials, textile design or product design that improve the overall impact of the collection on the environment and / or the wearer, whilst still remaining commercially viable.
93b8d1e5-607f-480b-beb2-a727b1ed94e4.name: Winner - Karl Lagerfeld Award for Innovation, International Woolmark Prize

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate innovative use of fabrics and textiles and has been producing commercial products for a minimum of 2 years and a maximum of 8 years (at the time of submitting the application)
Demonstrate consistent experience in working with apparel supply chains and show yearly growth in sales
Develop an innovative Merino wool collection, which takes into consideration sustainability and supply chain transparency
Entry must be creative, future focused, original, environmentally neutral / positive and commercially achievable
